```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
```

```{r}
library(tidyverse)
library(readr)
library(dplyr)
```


### Importing the data

```{r}
df <- read_csv("results_258_Conformity_Of_Norms_Replication_Group5_2021.csv")

df %>% 
  head()
```


### Glimps of the data

```{r}
df %>% 
  glimpse()
```


### Number of data points

```{r}
df %>% 
  nrow()
```


### Unique submission IDs with their counts

```{r}
df %>%
  group_by(submission_id) %>% 
  count() %>% 
  unique()
```


### Unique trials according to names

```{r}
df %>% 
  group_by(trial_name) %>% 
  count()
```


### Selecting the necessary columns

```{r}
df_cleaned <- df %>% 
  select(
    -c(
      RT,
     age,
     city,
     country,
     education,
     endTime,
     experiment_id,
     gender,
     startDate,
     startTime,
     trial_number
    )
  )
```


### Glimps after columns are removed

```{r}
df_cleaned %>% 
  glimpse()
```
